enhanced_by.reason: The fill() method ensures that the buffer is populated, which is crucial for the available() method to return accurate results.
The read() method updates the buffer position and length, which affects the available() method's calculation.
The baseReadFully() method checks if the underlying InputStream has been read fully, which is similar to the condition checked in available() when determining if there is more data to read.
The available() method of the underlying InputStream is called to determine if there is more data available, which is similar to the logic used in the available() method of SimpleBufferedInput.
